Posts.Content: Apr 27, 2012 04:18PM TerriD wrote: I created a thread if you care to comment or follow thanks t Could this be radiation burns or cellulitis???
Posts.Title: Armpit swollen all of a sudden with pain and now have fever crazypenguinsfan Cher56

Posts.Content: Apr 27, 2012 04:10AM TerriD wrote: ***URGENT*** HI Ladies, I will be posting this issue on various threads, because I need a pretty quick response, so thanks you to anyone who can help/share:  This question is for my mom. BACKGROUND: She just finished radiation. Not sure how many treatments, I think it was for 5 weeks.  She was stage 1, and this is her second cancer episode, first time was 10 years ago (me, her and my youngest sister have all had breast cancer twice each, and each recurrence was 10 years later...) OK QUESTION:  mom just called me her radiation dr told her she has cellulitis (last week) She has been on a sulfur oral antibiotic and has had no relief, hot-to-touch rash on rad site and tenderness. Now I have had my own issues with cellulitis, I have had many episodes (over 40) and have only had it 2x with out a fever present.  so I wonder... I also had a lot more rads then she did, so could it be radiation burns??  That she has?  I finished rads in 2009 and lost my skin etc, I did not end up with a hot to touch rash that was from radiation - that I am aware of, I did have hot-to-touch cellulitis issues (that started way b4 rads ever did) and was usually accompanied with a 103.5 fever. Mom  has no fever.  The rad dr gave her an oral antibiotic a week ago and it is still hot-to-touch. COULD THIS "JUST" be a radiation burn???  (I HATE to say "just", I know how hard it is...) If not, I have to assume it is cellulitis, like the dr said, but I know how hard it is to dx this animal. Mom is in FL I am in MI so I cant look at it, she says the "rash" is on her chest on the radiation site. In my case my rash went up my arm, and across the chest and back...hers is not spreading...so I wonder if this is just a rad side effect and NOT cellulitis??? The problem is she has heart issues and has also had c-diff in the past, so allowing a strep bacteria unattended is a real bad idea, and having IV antibiotics would be hard too (due to her c-diff history).  She is ready to go to the ER, either way I told her that this should not be treated by her rad dr, that she needs to see an infectious disease dr.  Suggestions?  comments?  Oh, and just in case can anyone recommend an Infectious disease dr in Ft Lauderdale area?  THANKS Terri
Posts.Title: Armpit swollen all of a sudden with pain and now have fever crazypenguinsfan Cher56

Posts.Content: TerriD wrote: I am wondering if anyone else gets rashes and fevers?  I have mild lymphedema (maybe 25% swelling) since my mascetomey Dec2009. Aometimes wekly, and at least 1x a month I get a rash that strts on my lower foream, looks like spots, chicken pox, welts. Then it spread to my upper arm, looks like a sunburn. Spotty rash on my chest, sunburn rash on my stomach. Rash NEVER passes my midline, and always stays on my mascetomy side. It is sometimes sore to touch and always hot to touch. Fever follows the rash and stays about 24 hours, and goes up to 103.5. Rash will stay 3 days -2 weeks (but pain and heat stops after a few days). I have had this about 30 times in the past 14 months. NO doctor has been able to dx it. I wonder if it is connected ot the lymphedema?  I have been to my primary dr, allergist, dermatologists, Infectious disease dr. Shingles, cellulitis have been ruled out. The rash strted 2 montsh after surgery, and when I satrted chemo, never stopped when treatment stopped, kept going strong thru radiation, and I ma now "healthy" aside from this terrible dillema.  I AM ON NO MEDS at all...ANY suggestions welcome!  THANKS ---Terri in Michigan 2x survivor. 1Peter 2:24 Claim Victory! Dx1 age 37 Masc 2/2000 Tumor 4.5cm ER+ Implant Chemo 6 months Dx2 age46 Masc 12/2008 No recons.ER+ Chemo 6 months 36Rads 2/12 Lymph nodes Mild Lymphadema Re-current cellulitis (well over 100 episodes!) Posts.Title: Rash and fever? TerriD TerriD

Posts.Content: May 4, 2010 01:05PM TerriD wrote: Well I called the Infectious dr again today, that makes 4 messages. I saw him last Monday. The girls in his office said, well thats odd, he just has a note "odd rash".  She said they will text him and one of the office people will call me back. and that this was very unusual, him not having followed up. I said, well since I will obviously not be speaking to him directly,  please ask him to perscribe an antibiotic for me for cellulitis, so this maybe wont come back. She said, well we dont usually work like that. I said, an anitibiotic will not hurt me if that is not the right course of treatment, it is inexpensive and may actually cure me...so WHY not tickle my fancy?  and if I am wrong I will so humbly apologize. Obviously this is an unusual case.  GUESS WHAT?  NO call back yet, and it is after 4pm.  what the hey?
Posts.Title: Rash and fever? TerriD TerriD

Posts.Content: May 6, 2010 05:49PM TerriD wrote: nothing on your arm?  were you swollen at all?   hope your doing better...
Posts.Title: Rash and fever? TerriD TerriD

Posts.Content: May 5, 2010 02:55PM TerriD wrote: Well the Infectious dr called back today and said he is stumped. He apologized for not getting back to me sooner. I begged for an antibiotic and told him about the picture of cellultits which is very similar to my rash. He said he sees cellulitis everyday, and also incorrect dx's of cellulitis from other drs everyday, and I do not have it. He said that cellulitis that goes away and comes back chronically without any antibiotics is extremely unlikely and rare.  BUT, when the rash errupts, fresh and new again, he wants to see me right away.  He gave me his cell number.  I also made an appointment with the local Lymphedema clinic to work on my swelling...so, we will wait and see...where we go from here...HUGS terri
Posts.Title: Rash and fever? TerriD TerriD

Posts.Content: May 28, 2010 05:09PM TerriD wrote: NO, she didnt take any measurements, or do anything but talk to me. She called me today and said that until we are sure the cellulitis is gone, I can not even wear a compression garment. Believe me I DO rest enough, too much actually.  I WILL be gentle with myself, and hope that within the next few months I will get the go ahead to begin treatment for the lymphedema.  Thanks for the hugs, terri
Posts.Title: Rash and fever? TerriD TerriD

Posts.Content: May 23, 2010 06:12PM TerriD wrote: The rash started Thursday, fever went up to 102.5, I called the infectious disease dr, saw him and was admitted to teh hospital for the past 48 hrs. I had 5 IV antibiotic doses for CELLULITIS!!!!  I had quite a parade of docs --- my primary, infectious disease, surgeon, chemo dr and an endocrinologist. AND I think they are finally agreeing on CELLULITIS!!! What a surprise, I have been telling them that for over a year. I am home now, and need to take  oral antibiotics for 8 weeks. Unless it flares up again. I am battered and bruised from pokes and needles. But am HAPPY I was fianlly treated. VERY UPSET with chemo dr. He was making like he knew it was cellulitis and HAD BEEN TREATING ME all along, and I was a nut running around to all these other drs looking for attention. I was like, nooooo, you havent EVER treated me, go home and read my file you DING DONG!  Whatever, not going to let him steal my JOY!!!!.
Posts.Title: Rash and fever? TerriD TerriD

Posts.Content: May 24, 2010 03:32AM TerriD wrote: Yeah theer I sit saying I have been having this for 15 months and no one has given me ANY treatment at all, even when I flat out BEGGGED for an anitbiotic and TOLD them it was cellulitis...and he is telling them all "of course it is cellulitis, and i treated her for it, i even had her hospitalized for it..." ??????? I am like, nooooooooo....... The other drs said to me, "have you head what dr ding dong is saying, that he has treated you"?  and I just smiled coyly and said, "he is mistaken, he needs to rea dmy chart".  The studen nurse has quite a journal entry to write about me, she was just standing there like she was watching a soap opera.  As the drs filed in one after another and had there little dialogs with me.  She said later "thank you so much for letting me watch----keep being your own advocate!"

Posts.Content: May 25, 2010 02:00PM TerriD wrote: I called the oncologists office 2day, I wanted to just touch base...and asked a innocent question, "what was teh name of that gyn dr he reccomemnded for me....?" The receptionist was like, "hey what happened to you I saw you were in the hospital." I just blew her off, she put me on hold, when she came back she gave me that drs name, and I asked, so is the DR in? she said yes, and I said, hmmm, he didnt ask to talk to me? she said, He asked me to pull your chart."  PULL MY CHART???? NOW!!!!!! I was hospitalized FRIDAY, and he is just pulling my chart NOW!  I got a few oncologist names yesterday and am intending to call them, I NEVER intend to return to my oncologists office again.  My surgeon ordered an MRI for me, it is June 1.  argh. at least hopefuilly my darn experience will help someone else one day. hugs
Posts.Title: Rash and fever? TerriD TerriD

Posts.Content: May 28, 2010 08:48AM TerriD wrote: well i finally got a lymphedema appointment (to learn self massage and wrapping etc) and after my very long intake appt, it came out i was recently hospitaized for cellulits and guess what? they cant treat me til they are sure the underlying infection is gone. see, my cellulits has a very strange presentation where it goes seemingly away, you can not see it anymore and then it flares back up a week-3 weeks later.  so, she sent me away. basically the lympathatic fliud is a petri dish for infection, which can be causing the cellulitis, but we cant manipulate the lymph fluid with out risking spreading the hidden infection, so the lymphadema could be a cause of the cellulitis and the cellulits could be the casue of teh lympadema, round and round.  I asked about wearing a compression garment on my arm caus ethe swelling had dramatically decreased due to the IV antibiotics and I am concerned about the swelling getting worse with the heat and all, but was told NO can do, you can not compress the cellulitis area. argh!

Posts.Content: May 23, 2010 06:50PM TerriD wrote: I was also VERY concerned about the repercussions of having UNTREATED cellulitis for 15 months.  They said, it most likely damaged my lymphatic system and that there was nothing else to worry about BUT they took 12 viles of blood this morning. AND I was fortunate enough to get a CTscan and a MRI is scheduled for  nest week...my chemo dr was NOT going to scan me (he doesnt beleive in follow up scans) BUT since he now had 5 drs looking at him...he ordered them!  The CT was FINE!!! so I am very releived and pleased.  hugs

I also have Singulair to try and help control the outbreaks.  The biopsy said "chemically induced" so everyone, except the chemo dr is blaming it in the chemo.  Well, I FINISHED chemo last July!  DebZ, how did they know you had an infection?  What kind of dr dx'd you? Did your rash come and go also? Posts.Title: Rash and fever? TerriD TerriD

Posts.Content: TerriD wrote: Hi Ladies, I have had recurrent cellulitis since Jan 2009. This started a month after my (second) mastectomy and right after chemo. Left arm became bright red, actually at that time the "sunburn like rash" spread across my stomach and back half way and from my collar bone to my belly button, hot to touch, high fever (up to 103.8) body aches, soreness in arm, increased lymphatic swelling (you know the drill). All during chemo (for 7 months) I got this once a week. During radiation it was every other week, and then the episodes got less frequent down to 3-4 a year. It took drs 1.5 years to diagnose me and I began IV antibiotics for 6-8 weeks at a time, then moved to oral antibiotics Augmentin 875 for the past 5 years or so. Finally, in 2013 (4 years in) I got a reprieve; no cellulitis for 14 months. I had taken steps to get my diabetes in check, have done Physical therapy to reduce lymphedema swelling, use compression sleeves and use a Lymphatic pump daily for 1-2 hours (for 4 years now). Alas, the cellulitis returned and for the past 14 months the cellulitis episodes have been on a 6-8 week loop. Despite the symptoms reducing --to "just"spots/blotches, fever's stay low grade etc. Before I see any visible signs, I get the body aches, arm pain, back aches, I get irritable (blood pressure spikes)...and then I see the spots (which means no pumping of course so swelling get pretty bad again). Aside from Augmentin I have been getting a 3-day in a row shots of Recepitin … and I admit I just realized I have had a defeatist attitude lately. A few months ago I was at the drs and I was like, this is my new normal, I will never be well, I just have to learn to live with this...but yesterday I was talking to someone who brought up a few good points and gave me HOPE! New plan: 1- I need to lose weight, it's not good for my diabetes or lymphedema, so there's that battle of the bulge to begin...2- I called for a consult with a holistic dr (yeah right $700 not including labs to get a diagnosis- so that's not happening. And 3- I am now exploring Hyperbolic Oxygen Therapy, so, MY QUESTION is: Has anyone out there dealing with lymphedema or cellulitis TRIED THIS? I hope to hear tales of healing, but since there are not too many of us with recurrent cellulitis; I understand the odds of that are bleak. Anyone care to share? Thanks and God Bless you all on your healing journeys, hugs, Terri aka termite 2x survivor. 1Peter 2:24 Claim Victory! Dx1 age 37 Masc 2/2000 Tumor 4.5cm ER+ Implant Chemo 6 months Dx2 age46 Masc 12/2008 No recons.ER+ Chemo 6 months 36Rads 2/12 Lymph nodes Mild Lymphadema Re-current cellulitis (well over 100 episodes!) Posts.Title: Cellulitis and Hyperbaric Oxygen therapy??? TerriD glennie19

Posts.Content: Jun 9, 2010 06:18PM - edited Jun 9, 2010 06:22PM by TerriD Thanks for the well wishes!  I will let you all know asap.  They arent suspecting anything terrible, just checking my chest wall because of my recurrent cellulitis.  ANYWAY...interesting news. I met with my new oncologist and when he informed me that the nccn guidelines...blah blah blah...in my situation does'nt reccomend folowup tests (other than tumor markers and thourough exams) He said although I had breast cancer twice, and it was in my lymph nodes, I was not high risk, high risk was 4 lymph nodes and I only had 2, sooo he was only reccomending tumor markers every 6 months (i must have looked like i was going to pop a boil-cause he changed his opinion to every 3 months for now) I asked him, "why is it my sisters who have never had breast cancer get mris every year and i am refused, since i have already had the disease, shouldnt i be followed closely?  they used to do that (years ago)".  he said well, studies have shown if they catch the initial breast cancer sooner then the cure and survivorship stats are way up, but (are you ready for this?) if a person who has already had breast cancer gets mets it doesnt matter whether they find the mets thru a test of if i have symptoms, either way studies have shown no increased life expectancy.  NOW, I am not in agreement with this at all.  i think that there definately would be a longer time to live and a better quality of life if mets was found while it was small and new rather than after you are showing signs of illness.  He doesnt even do chest xrays!  to check the lungs.  WOW!  He said all comprehensive cancer facilities were in agreement with teh no follow up scan mentality and sure i could find a dr to accomodate me based on emotion, but that would not be "good doctoring".  I am so fed up with this cancer  bol---der---dash  stuff!  hugs
Posts.Title: Breast MRI sproutdr Lisa1962

Posts.Content: Jun 11, 2010 03:59AM TerriD wrote: To be sure I understand where you are at with your bcancer, let me review...So you are a breast and colon cancer survivor (CONGRATS!!!!) and you had an excisonal biopsy which was OK (last year?). And because they can't find your last films they have no comparison to determine the status of your suspicious area. WHO ordered the mammogram? Your internist?  I see you did not have chemo for your breast cancer treatment. THAT being said, if you do not need a referral to see Drs, which it seems like you don't, and being that the oncologist has never treated you for your breast cancer, "I" would call my surgeon or gyn dr and ask for an ultrasound and/or a breast MRI.  Who do you have the best relationship with? FRANKLY I do not trust needle biopsy, as both my hubby and I have had them come back inconclusive or 99.00% a-OK (and they were malignant).  I would demand further testing.  In MY experience, both my surgeon and gyn are the most cooperative under these conservative guidelines times for testing put out by the NCCN.  Your gyn dr could do it also for you, but at this point you are a step above the qualifications of most internists (JMHO). Sometimes my surgeon (who I still see once a year) will actually order the tests or scans the week before my appointment, if you call and explain what is going on they can do this and save you a co-pay.  IN any event, GOOD LUCK!!! to you, AND please please please be sure to KEEP COPIES OF ALL ALL ALL YOUR TESTS, I have found drs are more thorough (and actually read the scans) when you ask for copies.  My hubby's test showed cancer 3 months before we were told, it showed up on the scan, and the dr didn't read it til the morning we went for his "at you convenience we'll remove it" surgery.  Hugs Terri
Posts.Title: what doctor do I talk to? susan_CNY CopterNadle

Posts.Content: Jun 8, 2010 09:02AM TerriD wrote: Had my MRI this morning. 2time Breast cancer survivor. no breasts left. Silly me thought I would get to lay on my back, they said "nope, face down sweet-heart".  This tube had no mirrors, when I said, I thought this was an open MRI, she said, "it is, see we have a large opening at the end and your feet hang out". Sooooo, I used visualization: thought about fun things that I did this year, pictured my upcoming vacation, remembered my last visit with my mom which was awesome, and took time to make things right with God. I admitted to him I am a fraud, everyone around me thinks I am so solid with God, and I am not. This past experience with cancer I have internally crawled into a corner, and even though I was so surrounded by a huge support system, I was so alone, inside.  No one knew, not even my husband.  ANYWAY, back to your initial question, maybe you can have them say, "10 more minutes, 5 more minutes"...so you can mentally get thru the "24 minutes" that seemed like 2 hours!  Also, becasue I got nasaeus with my last CT scan, I purposely didnt eat anything before I went to the MRI, anyone else have trouble with naseaus?  I DID NOT get sick from teh MRI, also did NOT get naseaus, but I was concerned I might.  The hardest part was when my radiated arm got numb from the position, my shoulder has yet to reciver, and THAT was the hand holding the help ball, I didnt think I would be OK after, but I was. GOOD LUCK!  hugs t

Not sure how many treatments, I think it was for 5 weeks.  She was stage 1, and this is her second cancer episode, first time was 10 years ago (me, her and my youngest sister have all had breast cancer twice each, and each recurrence was 10 years later...) OK QUESTION:  mom just called me her radiation dr told her she has cellulitis (last week) She has been on a sulfur oral antibiotic and has had no relief, hot-to-touch rash on rad site and tenderness. Now I have had my own issues with cellulitis, I have had many episodes (over 40) and have only had it 2x with out a fever present.  so I wonder... I also had a lot more rads then she did, so could it be radiation burns??  That she has?  I finished rads in 2009 and lost my skin etc, I did not end up with a hot to touch rash that was from radiation - that I am aware of, I did have hot-to-touch cellulitis issues (that started way b4 rads ever did) and was usually accompanied with a 103.5 fever. Mom  has no fever.  The rad dr gave her an oral antibiotic a week ago and it is still hot-to-touch. COULD THIS "JUST" be a radiation burn???  (I HATE to say "just", I know how hard it is...) If not, I have to assume it is cellulitis, like the dr said, but I know how hard it is to dx this animal. Mom is in FL I am in MI so I cant look at it, she says the "rash" is on her chest on the radiation site. In my case my rash went up my arm, and across the chest and back...hers is not spreading...so I wonder if this is just a rad side effect and NOT cellulitis??? The problem is she has heart issues and has also had c-diff in the past, so allowing a strep bacteria unattended is a real bad idea, and having IV antibiotics would be hard too (due to her c-diff history).  She is ready to go to the ER, either way I told her that this should not be treated by her rad dr, that she needs to see an infectious disease dr.  Suggestions?  comments?  Oh, and just in case can anyone recommend an Infectious disease dr in Ft Lauderdale area?  THANKS Terri 2x survivor. 1Peter 2:24 Claim Victory! Posts.Title: Could this be radiation burns or cellulitis??? TerriD Kindergarten

Posts.Content: Apr 28, 2012 03:18AM TerriD wrote: Cookie, the good thing is your Dr recognized the infection, mine did not...did he give you antiobiotics??? The thing is no matter how sick I was (103.5 fevers) they NEVER considered stoppingthe rads. My last day I was so very sick and didnt want to go, I said I am done! They were like, get in here, or we will come to get you.  I was so ill I couldnt even drive home...ah...memories...I am so glad ot be done with that...so naturally my mom was very intuitive when she saw the "rash", and she knew what to do...but...I am suspecting it is alot more rad burns then cellulitis, her fever broke a few days ago... hugs t
Posts.Title: Could this be radiation burns or cellulitis??? TerriD Kindergarten

Posts.Title: A little worried Mayquiri TerriD

Posts.Content: Jun 6, 2010 02:40AM TerriD wrote: see the thread excited to find cheap camis at target...I am now the very happy wearer of a size 7 beanie foob and champion sports bra (seamless and duo dry with ventilation)  The foob is incredibly light weight and soft and comfy and so is teh bra. The bra is a pull it over your head design, but has thin straps over the shoulders unlike most sports bras. THANKS!!!!
Posts.Title: FOAM brest forms TerriD Erica

Posts.Content: May 27, 2011 07:14PM - edited May 27, 2011 07:15PM by TerriD HI Ladies, I am a survivor, and am researching for my younger sister who was just re-dx'd with satge 4. It is in her liver, she is still undergoing tests at this point.  I am wondering, becasue when I was doing chemo my onc told me NO supplements (he has a dont strengthen the cancer cells policy), However I know Vitamin D is very important etc.  So do you think he (my onc) has a valid oint? or do you suggest supplementin?   @Camille, yes I woul appreciate your information. Thanks Terri
Posts.Title: Diet, suplements and Stage IV alicia_en_madrid K-Lo

Posts.Content: Jun 3, 2010 06:17PM TerriD wrote: My son was 4 when I was first sick, and he too thought I was dying. Kids that age they are just trying to figure things out. He actually asked my friends if I died if he could live with them.  It was hard.  I tried to "act" as life-like as possible, taking naps when he wasnt around, and having people take him out of the house when I was very tired and irritable.  I think you did a great job.  Offer him comfort and let him know he will always be OK. Thier little worlds are scarey, they are so dependent on us.  ((((HUGS)))))
Posts.Title: My 4 year old son's questions about dying....breaks my heart lorieg lorieg

Posts.Content: TerriD wrote: I havent had reconstruction yet (still deciding). I had reconstruction on my right side, but it is like a flat dented hamburger bun and I am not imporessed. On my left I am flat (my most recent  mascetomy side). Which I finished radiation on in November. I kind of baby that side, and am a bit uncomfortable there and even though I have (regular heavy) prosthetics, I wear camis still and can't wear them cause they are too heavy. So  I have been looking for a LIGHTWEIGHT prosthetics (not fiber fluff) any ideas?  Thanks and hugs terri 2x survivor. 1Peter 2:24 Claim Victory! Posts.Title: Excited to find cheap Camisoles at Target coonie coonie

Posts.Content: Jun 1, 2010 10:14AM - edited Jun 1, 2010 10:17AM by TerriD Does anyone have the LINK for the Target cami online?  I can not find it! Thanks terri
Posts.Title: Excited to find cheap Camisoles at Target coonie coonie

Posts.Content: Jun 5, 2010 08:31PM TerriD wrote: Well I just got my bead-foobs and I am amazed at how light weight they are, they weigh nothing!  I was trying to fit one over my reconstruction side to even out with my non reconstructed side and ordered several sizes. In the end, I decided to leave the reconstructed side alone and go with a size 7 on my non reconstructed side (I "was" a 42D once upon a time).  What I am saying is that because I had a reconstruction on my right, which looks like a demented hamburger bun, and decided not to add anything on top of it, even though the chart said I should be a 9, I am wearing a 7 beanie boob.  Now, about the sport bras I got at target. They have thin bra-like straps, not thick regular sport bra type straps, and they do not have pockets!  BUT they are very comfortable and I just tucked my beanie boob in and it seems secure.  Comfort was important as I am still a bit tender from radiation, my spandex camis were too hot and These are pretty enough that if they peek out of my shirt it would be OK, and they are not clingy, I had a hard time wearing t-shirts over my spandex camis cause they clung to my cami top and it looked weird.  The sports bras code is Champion Duo dry seamless 214 05 0376 - the last 4 digits indicate the color; I got fuscia, dusty blue white and gray. These do not have clips you pull them over your head.  You can always have foob holder cups put in if you need to but these foobs are so light I don't think it is necessary.  This is just temporary till I figure out what I want to do reconstruction wise; I am trying to clear up the cellulitis first.  ; ) Hope this helps someone somewhere. And thank you all for you help! too.
Posts.Title: Excited to find cheap Camisoles at Target coonie coonie

Posts.Content: TerriD wrote: ****CAUTION****PLEAS DONT READ IF YOU HAVE YET TO DO RADIATION****I AM SURE NOT EVERYONE HAS THIS HAPPEN TO THEM... Ladies, I finished radiation In November. It was pretty harsh, they used a bolus (sp?) towel and basically acheiv d the "desired effect" of scalding the skin right off my body. I am healed up pretty nicely, still have a postage-stamped area though.  Lately I feel tingles in my chest, like maybe my skin is trying to rejunvinate?  What I need to ask is I seem to be having chest pains, like contractions. I am hoping this is not due to heart troubles, and maybe it is NORMAL for after radiation to have your muscles or skin contract as they heal???? I did have untreated cellulits for over a year and know that strep affects the heart, and am hoping that this contraction crap is just from rads...any ideas?  I DO have a cardiologist appt set up buy the earlies they could se eme was not for another 2 weeks. THANKS fo ryour thoughts, hugs terri 2x survivor. 1Peter 2:24 Claim Victory!
